definition[0]: to secretly plan with someone else to do something illegal
example[0]: All six men admitted conspiring to steal cars.
example[1]: There was some evidence that he had been conspiring against the government.
definition[1]: if events conspire to do something, they happen at the same time and make something bad happen
example[2]: Pollution and neglect have conspired to ruin the city.
example[3]: Emily felt that everything was conspiring against her.
